quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Mushroom and Mushrooms
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, condition, mushrooms. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What type of meal is the traditional Chinese Zha jiang mian dish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Noodle dish

questions.question: What is the literal translation of the word chatang, which refers toa traditional Chinese gruel sold as a snack on the street?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tea soup

questions.question: Which of these mushrooms is a wild form of the Enokitake mushroom, used in Asian cuisines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Name the traditional Chinese meal made from glutinous rice stuffed with different fillings and wrapped in bamboo or reed leaves, and cooked by steaming or boiling.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zongzi

questions.question: In what time of the day is the traditional Chinese meal called You tiao usually eaten?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morning

questions.question: To what continent is the poisonous mushroom known as death cap indigenous?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Europe

questions.question: What does the traditional Chinese delicacy shark fin soup contain in high quantities which may cause sterility in men?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mercury

questions.question: What does the name of the Maitake mushroom mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dancing mushroom

questions.question: How did the shaggy ink cap mushroom get its interesting name?

options.text: Because it secretes a black liquid and its cap looks like a shaggy hairdo
Because it has been formerly used in ink production
Because its cap is black and messy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because it secretes a black liquid and its cap looks like a shaggy hairdo

questions.question: In what climate zone does the popular Parasol mushroom grow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Temperate

questions.question: What is the color of the mushroom known as flower-pot parasol and plantpot dapperling?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yellow

questions.question: What s another name for the chaga mushroom, a parasitic fungus growing mainly on birch trees?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cinder conk

questions.question: Oyster mushrooms are used to treat what medical condition?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: High cholesterol levels

questions.question: What is the popular Chinese Peking Duck traditionally served with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What important vitamin do button mushrooms, a.k.a. common mushrooms, contain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Type and Cheese
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, roquefort, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these is the name of a popular Canadian blue cheese variety?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dragons Breath

questions.question: What do the nests of cave swifts consist of, which makes them edible and ranks them as a delicacy in Chinese cuisine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saliva

questions.question: Bao yu, a prized ingredient used in many Chinese dishes, is what type of sea food?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sea snail

questions.question: What other interesting name is commonly used for the Chinese meal fo tiao qiang, also known as Consummation of Happiness and Longevity?

options.text: A Geisha Sings Under The Blossoming Peach
The Son Of The Emperor Is Born

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buddha Jumps Over the Wall

questions.question: The term espresso roast refers to what kind of bean?

options.text: moderately dark with no visible oil on the surface of the bean
relatively dark but this varies greatly depending on personal tastes and the variety of bean used
very dark with a glossy sheen

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: relatively dark but this varies greatly depending on personal tastes and the variety of bean used

questions.question: What type of meat is used for the preparation of the Chinese meal called Char siu?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pork

questions.question: What type of milk is Brie cheese traditionally made of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cows milk

questions.question: The Emmental cheese is known by this name in North America, Australia and New Zealand.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Swiss cheese

questions.question: What type of cheese is the Roquefort, also called Rochefort?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue cheese

questions.question: What texture does Gruyere cheese traditionally have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hard

questions.question: In what type of leaves is Valdeon cheese traditionally wrapped before being sent to the market?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chestnut leaves

questions.question: In what country did the Cheddar cheese originate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: England

questions.question: What type of milk is Brussels cheese made of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cows milk

questions.question: In what country did the Castelo Branco cheese originate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Portugal

questions.question: What does the name of the Mozzarella cheese mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To cut

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Espresso and Cheese
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, facts, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the best evidence of a properly brewed espresso shot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: its crema

questions.question: What type of milk is used for the preparation of the Manchego cheese?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sheeps milk

questions.question: The term Espresso refers to which of these facts?

options.text: Hot water is pressed through finely ground coffee.
The coffee should be served and drunk quickly.
It could be any or all of these.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It could be any or all of these.

questions.question: In order to extract superior espresso consistently, you must precisely control many factors. Which of the following is not one of those factors?

options.text: The tamping pressure to press the coffee grounds into the portafilter
Fat content of milk you use
The amount of coffee grounds you use in each dose

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fat content of milk you use

questions.question: A serving of espresso contains more caffeine than a serving of instant coffee.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In what country did Raclette cheese originate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Switzerland

questions.question: What substance does the Brocciu cheese not contain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lactose

questions.question: What type of cheese is the Gorgonzola cheese?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue cheese

questions.question: What development revolutionized the extraction of espresso?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The pump

questions.question: Which statement regarding the difference between Cafe macchiato and Caffellatte is true?

options.text: One is espresso based the other is prepared with regular coffee and steamed milk.
Both are espresso based but contain different amounts of milk and milk foam.
One is sweetened, the other is not.
Both are espresso based but contain different kinds of milk products.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both are espresso based but contain different amounts of milk and milk foam.

questions.question: What is Cafe Mocha?

options.text: A beverage extracted using an espresso machine loaded with ground roasted cacao beans
Coffee brewed or extracted using beans from Mocha, Yemen.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coffee brewed or extracted using beans from Mocha, Yemen.

questions.question: What texture does Parmigiano-Reggiano, or parmesan cheese have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hard

questions.question: Which statement about the development of Espresso is true?

options.text: It was originally developed by a famous Seattle coffee house.
It was originally developed in France and was later refined in Italy.
It was originally developed in the 20th century in Milan.
It was originally developed by the Etruscans.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was originally developed in the 20th century in Milan.

questions.question: In what country of the UK was Dunlop cheese created?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scotland

questions.question: What is Barista?

options.text: The term applied to an expert coffee roaster
The proprietor of a coffee shop

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Italian word for bartender

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Herb and Genus
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, condition, making. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what country was the Chihuahua cheese created?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mexico

questions.question: What was Pot Marigold, a.k.a. Calendula, used for in the past, apart from medicinal purposes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: As a dye

questions.question: The genus to which yarrow belongs is named after this mythological Greek hero, who allegedly used yarrow to treat soldiers wounds.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Achilles

questions.question: Common sage, also known as Garden sage, was found to be beneficial in mild to moderate cases of this dangerous disease.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alzheimers disease

questions.question: What type of milk is the Grana Padano cheese made from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cows milk

questions.question: In what shape is the Caciocavallo cheese traditionally produced?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tear-drop

questions.question: What does the name of the herb dandelion mean in French?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lions tooth

questions.question: In the treatment of what medical condition is the herb St Johns wort considered beneficial?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: This herb, with the scientific name Veronica officinalis, is native to Europe and Asia, and is very rich in vitamins and antioxidants.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the origin of the word yogurt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Turkish

questions.question: Why is thyme tea traditionally given to women after childbirth in Jamaica?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To cause uterine contractions

questions.question: What should cows be fed on to produce the milk used for the making of Cantal cheese?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hay

questions.question: Stinging nettle has a large number of medicinal properties. What vitamin, essential for blood clotting, does fresh stinging nettle contain in large amounts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin K

questions.question: For centuries, the herbs from the genus Mentha, commonly known as mint, have been used to treat this medical problem.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What does the name of the herb Chamomile literally mean in Greek?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earth apple

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Yogurt and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, condition, fruits. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the treatment and prevention of what medical condition is yogurt proven to be beneficial?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these animals is a pest for the Garden strawberry, feeding on its fruit and leaves and transmitting various diseases?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What EU country first discovered the therapeutic powers of yogurt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France

questions.question: In what country is the yogurt Zabady produced?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Egypt

questions.question: What is the most commonly used word for yogurt in India, as the word yogurt is unknown there?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dahi

questions.question: What essential nutrient is plain yogurt rich in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The strawberry is an accessory fruit, meaning the fleshy part is modified receptacle tissue. What term is used as a synonym for an accessory fruit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: According to Russian biologist Ilya Mechnikov what explained the longevity of certain Bulgarian peasants?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The bacteria in yogurt

questions.question: What vitamin is the Garden strawberry a rich source of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin C

questions.question: Which of these fruits is a an accessory fruit, just like strawberries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these is a basic ingredients of the summer yogurt soup called tarator, very popular on the Balkans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: People who are lactose-intolerant should not consume yogurt or milk.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 1919, Isaac Carasso established the first industrialized production of yogurt under the name Danone. What does Danone mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little Daniel

questions.question: What country is the largest producer of strawberries in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: United States

questions.question: In what country was the Garden strawberry first bred in 1740?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Bread and Type
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, making, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What vegetable is used for the preparation of the traditional Norwegian bread called Lefse?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Potato

questions.question: What leavening agent is used for the popular French bread called Baguette?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yeast

questions.question: What type of flour is used for the preparation of the bread called Broa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Corn flour

questions.question: In what country did the bread called Flatkaka appear for the first time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iceland

questions.question: What is the cause of strawberry allergic reactions, such as the Oral allergy syndrome?

options.text: The presence of a toxin in the fruit
The red pigment in the fruit

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The red pigment in the fruit

questions.question: In what country did the bread variety called Tunnbrod originate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sweden

questions.question: What type of bread is the Turkish bread variety called Yufka?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flatbread

questions.question: The Italian bread called Focaccia resembles this other traditional Italian dish.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pizza

questions.question: What property of microfiber makes it ideal for the making of clothes and underwear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What type of meat is used for the preparation of the traditional Indonesian dish called Betutu?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicken

questions.question: Zopf is a type of Swiss bread traditionally consumed on Sunday mornings. What does its name mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Braid

questions.question: What type of food is the Indonesian dish called Klepon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dessert

questions.question: What was canvas originally made from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hemp

questions.question: How was the South Asian bread called Puri prepared?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By frying

questions.question: The bread called Marraqueta was invented in this South American country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chile
